00035 template<typename T, bool isNumber> struct getMinMaxImpl {
00036     std::pair<T, T> operator()( const TypePtr<T> &ref ) const {
00037         LOG( Debug, error ) << "min/max comparison of " << util::Type<T>::staticName() << " is not supportet";
00038         return std::pair<T, T>();
00039     }
00040 };
00041 template<typename T> struct getMinMaxImpl<T, true> {
00042     std::pair<T, T> operator()( const TypePtr<T> &ref ) const {
00043         std::pair<T, T> result;
00044 
00045         for ( size_t i = 0; i < ref.len(); i++ ) {
00046             if ( result.second < ref[i] )result.second = ref[i];
00047 
00048             if ( result.first > ref[i] )result.first = ref[i];
00049         }
00050 
00051         return result;
00052     }
00053 };
00054 
00055 }

00065 template<typename TYPE> class TypePtr: public _internal::TypePtrBase
00066 {
00067     boost::shared_ptr<TYPE> m_val;
00068     template<typename T> TypePtr( const util::Type<T>& value ); // Dont do this
00069 protected:
00070     const boost::weak_ptr<void> getRawAddress()const {
00071         return boost::weak_ptr<void>( m_val );
00072     }
00073     TypePtrBase *clone() const {
00074         return new TypePtr( *this );
00075     }
00076 public:
00077     static const unsigned short staticID = util::_internal::TypeId<TYPE>::value << 8;
00079     class DelProxy : public boost::shared_ptr<TYPE>
00080     {
00081     public:
00087         DelProxy( const TypePtr<TYPE> &master ): boost::shared_ptr<TYPE>( master ) {
00088             LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Creating DelProxy for " << this->get();
00089         }
00091         void operator()( TYPE *at ) {
00092             LOG( Debug, verbose_info )
00093                     << "Deletion for " << this->get() << " called from splice at offset "   << at - this->get()
00094                     << ", current use_count: " << this->use_count();
00095             this->reset();//actually not needed, but we keep it here to keep obfuscation low
00096         }
00097     };
00099     struct NonDeleter {
00100         void operator()( TYPE *p ) {
00101             //we have to cast the pointer to void* here, because in case of u_int8_t it will try to print the "string"
00102             LOG( Debug, info ) << "Not freeing pointer " << ( void * )p << " (" << TypePtr<TYPE>::staticName() << ") ";
00103         };
00104     };
00106     struct BasicDeleter {
00107         void operator()( TYPE *p ) {
00108             //we have to cast the pointer to void* here, because in case of u_int8_t it will try to print the "string"
00109             LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Freeing pointer " << ( void * )p << " (" << TypePtr<TYPE>::staticName() << ") ";
00110             free( p );
00111         };
00112     };
00114     struct ObjectArrayDeleter {
00115         void operator()( TYPE *p ) {
00116             //we have to cast the pointer to void* here, because in case of u_int8_t it will try to print the "string"
00117             LOG( Debug, info ) << "Deleting object array at " << ( void * )p << " (" << TypePtr<TYPE>::staticName() << ") ";
00118             delete[] p;
00119         };
00120     };
00125     TypePtr() {
00126         LOG( Debug, warning ) << "Creating an empty TypePtr of type " << util::MSubject( staticName() ) << " you should overwrite it with a usefull pointer before using it";
00127     }
00137     TypePtr( TYPE *const ptr, size_t length ):
00138         _internal::TypePtrBase( length ), m_val( ptr, BasicDeleter() ) {}
00149     template<typename D> TypePtr( TYPE *const ptr, size_t length, D d ):
00150         _internal::TypePtrBase( length ), m_val( ptr, d ) {}
00151 
00152     virtual ~TypePtr() {}
00153 
00155     void copyFromMem( const TYPE *const src, size_t length ) {
00156         LOG_IF( length > len(), Runtime, error )
00157                 << "Amount of the elements to copy from memory (" << length << ") exceeds the length of the array (" << len() << ")";
00158         TYPE &dest = this->operator[]( 0 );
00159         LOG( Debug, info ) << "Copying " << length *sizeof( TYPE ) << " bytes of " << typeName() << " from " << src << " to " << &dest;
00160         memcpy( &dest, src, length * sizeof( TYPE ) );
00161     }
00163     void copyToMem( size_t start, size_t end, TYPE *const dst )const {
00164         assert( start <= end );
00165         const size_t length = end - start + 1;
00166         LOG_IF( end >= len(), Runtime, error )
00167                 << "End of the range (" << end << ") is behind the end of this TypePtr (" << len() << ")";
00168         const TYPE &source = this->operator[]( start );
00169         memcpy( dst, &source, length * sizeof( TYPE ) );
00170     }
00171     size_t cmp( size_t start, size_t end, const _internal::TypePtrBase &dst, size_t dst_start ) const {
00172         assert( start <= end );
00173         size_t ret = 0;
00174         size_t length = end - start;
00175 
00176         if ( dst.typeID() != typeID() ) {
00177             LOG( Debug, error )
00178                     << "Comparing to a TypePtr of different type(" << dst.typeName() << ", not " << typeName()
00179                     << "). Assuming all voxels to be different";
00180             return length;
00181         }
00182 
00183         LOG_IF( end >= len(), Runtime, error )
00184                 << "End of the range (" << end << ") is behind the end of this TypePtr (" << len() << ")";
00185         LOG_IF( length + dst_start >= dst.len(), Runtime, error )
00186                 << "End of the range (" << length + dst_start << ") is behind the end of the destination (" << dst.len() << ")";
00187         const TypePtr<TYPE> &compare = dst.cast_to_TypePtr<TYPE>();
00188         LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Comparing " << dst.typeName() << " at " << &operator[]( 0 ) << " and " << &compare[0];
00189 
00190         for ( size_t i = start; i < end; i++ ) {
00191             if ( ! ( operator[]( i ) == compare[i] ) ) {
00192                 ret++;
00193             }
00194         }
00195 
00196         return ret;
00197     }
00198 
00200     virtual std::string toString( bool labeled = false )const {
00201         std::string ret;
00202 
00203         if ( m_len ) {
00204             const TYPE *ptr = m_val.get();
00205 
00206             for ( size_t i = 0; i < m_len - 1; i++ )
00207                 ret += util::Type<TYPE>( ptr[i] ).toString( false ) + "|";
00208 
00209             ret += util::Type<TYPE>( ptr[m_len-1] ).toString( labeled );
00210         }
00211 
00212         return boost::lexical_cast<std::string>( m_len ) + "#" + ret;
00213     }
00215     virtual std::string typeName()const {
00216         return staticName();
00217     }
00219     virtual unsigned short typeID()const {
00220         return staticID;
00221     }
00223     static std::string staticName() {
00224         return std::string( util::Type<TYPE>::staticName() ) + "*";
00225     }

00232     TYPE &operator[]( size_t idx ) {
00233         return ( m_val.get() )[idx];
00234     }
00235     const TYPE &operator[]( size_t idx )const {
00236         return ( m_val.get() )[idx];
00237     }
00244     operator boost::shared_ptr<TYPE>&() {return m_val;}
00245     operator const boost::shared_ptr<TYPE>&()const {return m_val;}

00247     TypePtrBase::Reference cloneToMem( size_t length ) const {
00248         return TypePtrBase::Reference( new TypePtr( ( TYPE * )malloc( length * sizeof( TYPE ) ), length ) );
00249     }
00250     size_t bytes_per_elem() const {
00251         return sizeof( TYPE );
00252     }
00254     void getMinMax ( util::TypeReference &min, util::TypeReference &max ) const {
00255         if ( len() == 0 ) {
00256             LOG( Runtime, warning ) << "Skipping computation of min/max on an empty TypePtr";
00257             return;
00258         }
00259 
00260         const std::pair<util::Type<TYPE>, util::Type<TYPE> > result = _internal::getMinMaxImpl<TYPE, boost::is_arithmetic<TYPE>::value>()( *this );
00261 
00262         if ( min.empty() || min->gt( result.first ) )
00263             min = result.first;
00264 
00265         if ( max.empty() || max->lt( result.second ) )
00266             max = result.second;
00267     }
00268 
00269     std::vector<Reference> splice( size_t size )const {
00270         if ( size >= len() ) {
00271             LOG( Debug, warning )
00272                     << "splicing data of the size " << len() << " up into blocks of the size " << size << " is kind of useless ...";
00273         }
00274 
00275         const size_t fullSplices = len() / size;
00276 
00277         const size_t lastSize = len() % size;//rest of the division - size of the last splice
00278 
00279         const size_t splices = fullSplices + ( lastSize ? 1 : 0 );
00280 
00281         std::vector<Reference> ret( splices );
00282 
00283         DelProxy proxy( *this );
00284 
00285         for ( size_t i = 0; i < fullSplices; i++ )
00286             ret[i].reset( new TypePtr( m_val.get() + i * size, size, proxy ) );
00287 
00288         if ( lastSize )
00289             ret.back().reset( new TypePtr( m_val.get() + fullSplices * size, lastSize, proxy ) );
00290 
00291         return ret;
00292     }
00293     //
00294 
00295 };
00296 
00297 template<typename T> bool _internal::TypePtrBase::is()const
00298 {
00299     util::check_type<T>();
00300     return typeID() == TypePtr<T>::staticID;
00301 }
